text: how do we change the timezone in hubdb?
Is it possible that this timezone is pulled from the Account Defaults? <https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/account/change-your-language-and-region-settings>
it says eastern standard for me

Would you rather:
a. We made it so you input time in your portal timezone, but save it in UTC +0, and then in your code, you had to specify timezone
b. We let you input the time in your portal timezone, and save it in your portal timezone, so your code does not need to specify timezone
c. Let you tell us a timezone you would like to enter time in/save it in

For the record, I am pretty sure blog posts are handled with option b, but we give you a special blog variable so you do not need to specify timezone in your code, we just convert it magically for you

I feel like users would want C – especially if they want item x to be in EST and item y to be in MST.
With the default time set to their portal time zone.
With this scenario it’d be unmanageable for devs to manage it with code.
indeed c) would be good, i think it would be more flexible.
can c) also include b) as a fallback, meaning, if nothing else is specified, portal timezone is the fallback?
c) definitely makes the most sense; a lot of users host events all over the map, it’s a little restricting with b).
